name: v0.8.0
description:
Now Daintree supports ECS clusters! Moreover, a lot of changes in the background to improve code quality and squash bugs:

### Added

* Support for ECS clusters

### Changed

* Refactor header and subheader to render just once and increase performance
* Move all components to new-ish Daintree classes to have coherent codebase
* Delete a lot of useless code
* Hovering the reload icon now shows the date of the last refresh
* Improve the alerts UI
* Improve the elastic ip, and the route table page: now they perform better when multiple changes are applied, and they always show updated data

### Fixed

* Remove internal error notification on login
* Fix 404 after creating a new peering connection
* Fix title and cancel button in the new sns topic page
description_html:
Now Daintree supports ECS clusters! Moreover, a lot of changes in the background to improve code quality and squash bugs:

Added

  • Support for ECS clusters

Changed

  • Refactor header and subheader to render just once and increase performance
  • Move all components to new-ish Daintree classes to have coherent codebase
  • Delete a lot of useless code
  • Hovering the reload icon now shows the date of the last refresh
  • Improve the alerts UI
  • Improve the elastic ip, and the route table page: now they perform better when multiple changes are applied, and they always show updated data

Fixed

  • Remove internal error notification on login
  • Fix 404 after creating a new peering connection
  • Fix title and cancel button in the new sns topic page

commit.title: Merge branch 'release/v0.8.0' into 'master'
commit.message:
Merge branch 'release/v0.8.0' into 'master'

Add support for ECS clusters, and a lot of refactoring

See merge request rpadovani/daintree!201

name: v0.7.0
description:
This release marks the beginning of support for ECS, with the introduction of ECS tasks. Moreover, now every resource page is responsive, has a better layout and almost every attribute has a help text to guide you through the mysteries of AWS!

### Added

* Add support for ECS tasks
* Improve the layout of the cards in pages about single resources, now it is responsive
* Add help text to a lot of resources' attributes

### Changed

* Refactored the tags table to use more modern Javascript
* Highlight when the owner of a resource is the logged user
* Improve legend of graphs including minimum and current

### Fixed

* Fix `The filter 'vpc' is invalid` error when checking route tables associated to a VPC
* Fix broken link to instance from elastic ip page
* Remove warning about expired credentials after login
description_html:
This release marks the beginning of support for ECS, with the introduction of ECS tasks. Moreover, now every resource page is responsive, has a better layout and almost every attribute has a help text to guide you through the mysteries of AWS!

Added

  • Add support for ECS tasks
  • Improve the layout of the cards in pages about single resources, now it is responsive
  • Add help text to a lot of resources' attributes

Changed

  • Refactored the tags table to use more modern Javascript
  • Highlight when the owner of a resource is the logged user
  • Improve legend of graphs including minimum and current

Fixed

  • Fix The filter 'vpc' is invalid error when checking route tables associated to a VPC
  • Fix broken link to instance from elastic ip page
  • Remove warning about expired credentials after login

name: v0.6.0
description:
This minor release adds support for VPC Peering connections, and prepares the basis for future updates.

### Added

* Support for VPC peering connections
* Instances and NAT gateways shows now also related route tables
description_html:
This minor release adds support for VPC Peering connections, and prepares the basis for future updates.

Added

  • Support for VPC peering connections
  • Instances and NAT gateways shows now also related route tables

commit.message:
Merge branch 'release/v0.6.0' into 'master'

v0.6.0

See merge request rpadovani/daintree!143

name: v0.5.0
description:
This new release brings a lot of goodies to Daintree: now you can navigate your EBS and Snapshots over all your regions. Also, you can see your related EC2 instances in VPCs, subnets, EBS, and key pairs page!

### Added

* Added support for EBS
* Added support for Snapshots
* Added a list of EC2 related instances to VPCs, subnets, EBS, and key pairs page: you can now see in a glance how such resources are linked to any of your instances!
* Added [Github](https://github.com/rpadovani/daintree) mirroring of the source code! If you want, you can follow development of the project also over there!

### Changed

* More coherent notifications when deleting resources
* Changed label style for Load Balancers and Instances status (thanks Gitlab developers!)

### Fixed

* Resources IDs in the URL are not case-sensitive anymore, fixing some broken internal link
* Improved how Daintree detects a work in progress resource
* Fixed a memory leak in displaying CloudWatch widgets
description_html:
This new release brings a lot of goodies to Daintree: now you can navigate your EBS and Snapshots over all your regions. Also, you can see your related EC2 instances in VPCs, subnets, EBS, and key pairs page!

Added

  • Added support for EBS
  • Added support for Snapshots
  • Added a list of EC2 related instances to VPCs, subnets, EBS, and key pairs page: you can now see in a glance how such resources are linked to any of your instances!
  • Added Github mirroring of the source code! If you want, you can follow development of the project also over there!

Changed

  • More coherent notifications when deleting resources
  • Changed label style for Load Balancers and Instances status (thanks Gitlab developers!)

Fixed

  • Resources IDs in the URL are not case-sensitive anymore, fixing some broken internal link
  • Improved how Daintree detects a work in progress resource
  • Fixed a memory leak in displaying CloudWatch widgets

commit.title: Merge branch 'release/0.5.0' into 'master'
commit.message:
Merge branch 'release/0.5.0' into 'master'

Release v0.5.0

See merge request rpadovani/daintree!124

name: v0.4.0
description:
This new release brings support for EC2 Key Pairs, and some bugfixes on how login credentials are managed. Also, there have been some refactoring, and thus it should be faster to add support for new resources, and less bug-prone.

Moreover, Daintree behaves better now on small screens!

[Suggestions and bug reports are more than welcome!](https://daintree.app/#/contribute)

### Added

* Added support for EC2 key pairs!

### Changed

* Increase responsiveness: now many pages behave better on small screens

### Fixed

* Now Daintree will detect when your credentials expire and will redirect you to the login page
* Fixed integration with @gitlab/ui library. Thanks [Paul Gascou-Vaillancourt](https://gitlab.com/pgascouvaillancourt) for suggestions and improvements upstream!
description_html:
This new release brings support for EC2 Key Pairs, and some bugfixes on how login credentials are managed. Also, there have been some refactoring, and thus it should be faster to add support for new resources, and less bug-prone.

Moreover, Daintree behaves better now on small screens!

Suggestions and bug reports are more than welcome!

Added

  • Added support for EC2 key pairs!

Changed

  • Increase responsiveness: now many pages behave better on small screens

Fixed

  • Now Daintree will detect when your credentials expire and will redirect you to the login page
  • Fixed integration with @gitlab/ui library. Thanks Paul Gascou-Vaillancourt for suggestions and improvements upstream!

name: v0.3.0
description:
Daintree now has read-only support for load balancers and target groups! 

It has support for monitoring and reading all the attributes about both load balancers and target groups.

If you find any bug, or you'd like to contribute, please read the [dedicated page!](https://daintree.app/#/contribute)

### Added

* Added support for load balancers and target groups

### Changed

* Improved style of the header dropdown, now uses Gitlab components instead of VueBootstrap ones
description_html:
Daintree now has read-only support for load balancers and target groups!

It has support for monitoring and reading all the attributes about both load balancers and target groups.

If you find any bug, or you'd like to contribute, please read the dedicated page!

Added

  • Added support for load balancers and target groups

Changed

  • Improved style of the header dropdown, now uses Gitlab components instead of VueBootstrap ones

commit.title: Merge branch 'release/v0.3.0' into 'master'
commit.message:
Merge branch 'release/v0.3.0' into 'master'

Release 0.3.0

See merge request rpadovani/daintree!83

name: v0.2.1
description:
This new patch release of Daintree brings fixes for the tags table: now you can again manage your tags for the network resources and edit the tags of your EC2 instances!

Also, there is a performance improvement due the removal of unneeded libraries - we rewrote the code to use native Javascript functions to ship less code!

### Changed

* Use native Date type instead of a library: this gives us more flexibility and improved performance, since there is less Javascript to download when you connect to the website
* Remove unused CSS for flags
* You can now manage tags for EC2 instances as you could already do for other resources

### Fixed

* Tags operations for networking resources work again
description_html:
This new patch release of Daintree brings fixes for the tags table: now you can again manage your tags for the network resources and edit the tags of your EC2 instances!

Also, there is a performance improvement due the removal of unneeded libraries - we rewrote the code to use native Javascript functions to ship less code!

Changed

  • Use native Date type instead of a library: this gives us more flexibility and improved performance, since there is less Javascript to download when you connect to the website
  • Remove unused CSS for flags
  • You can now manage tags for EC2 instances as you could already do for other resources

Fixed

  • Tags operations for networking resources work again

commit.title: Merge branch 'release/0.2.1' into 'master'
commit.message:
Merge branch 'release/0.2.1' into 'master'

Release 0.2.1

See merge request rpadovani/daintree!73

name: v0.2.0
description:
This new Daintree release brings new shiny features! You can now monitor your EC2 Instances, SQS Queues and Nat Gateway thanks to the Cloudwatch Metrics. Daintree also now remembers your credentials when you reload the page, and you can save your roles, so they will be there next time you login.

Here the full changelog:

### Added

* Created a new Cloudwatch component to show graphs about a single resource
* Used the new Cloudwatch component to provide information about SQS, Nat Gateways, EC2 instances
* Daintree now uses the session storage to keep your credentials: it means you can reload the page, and you are still logged in! Of course, as soon as you close the tab, the browser will delete everything from the session storage, so your credentials are perfectly safe;
* When you switch role, you can now save it: this way the next time you use Daintree you don't need to insert data about your role anymore! Daintree stores on your browser only metadata about the role, and not the actual credentials.

### Changed

* The secret access key field during the login is now marked as a password
* Daintree now is hosted behind Cloudflare! This should improve performances since resources will be cached longer: Daintree is hosted on Gitlab Pages, which has a non-configurable cache of only ten minutes.
description_html:
This new Daintree release brings new shiny features! You can now monitor your EC2 Instances, SQS Queues and Nat Gateway thanks to the Cloudwatch Metrics. Daintree also now remembers your credentials when you reload the page, and you can save your roles, so they will be there next time you login.

Here the full changelog:

Added

  • Created a new Cloudwatch component to show graphs about a single resource
  • Used the new Cloudwatch component to provide information about SQS, Nat Gateways, EC2 instances
  • Daintree now uses the session storage to keep your credentials: it means you can reload the page, and you are still logged in! Of course, as soon as you close the tab, the browser will delete everything from the session storage, so your credentials are perfectly safe;
  • When you switch role, you can now save it: this way the next time you use Daintree you don't need to insert data about your role anymore! Daintree stores on your browser only metadata about the role, and not the actual credentials.

Changed

  • The secret access key field during the login is now marked as a password
  • Daintree now is hosted behind Cloudflare! This should improve performances since resources will be cached longer: Daintree is hosted on Gitlab Pages, which has a non-configurable cache of only ten minutes.

name: v0.1.1
description:
Small improvements to static contents and performances.

### Changed

* Improve loading performance optimizing AWS library imports. The vendors file went from 3288.93 KiB to 933.97 KiB.
* Improve Changelog page aspect
* Bigger GIFs in the feature page

### Fixed

* The header now properly collapse on mobile
* The homepage renders in the same way on Chrome and Firefox
* Add meta description in the index page
description_html:
Small improvements to static contents and performances.

Changed

  • Improve loading performance optimizing AWS library imports. The vendors file went from 3288.93 KiB to 933.97 KiB.
  • Improve Changelog page aspect
  • Bigger GIFs in the feature page

Fixed

  • The header now properly collapse on mobile
  • The homepage renders in the same way on Chrome and Firefox
  • Add meta description in the index page

commit.title: Merge branch 'release/0.1.1' into 'master'
commit.message:
Merge branch 'release/0.1.1' into 'master'

Create release 0.1.1

See merge request rpadovani/daintree!10

name: v0.1.0
description:
This is the first public release of Daintree. It is still an early alpha, a proof of concept to start building an open-source alternative to the AWS Console. If you find any bug, or have any feedback, please write to `incoming+rpadovani-daintree-18158864-issue-@incoming.gitlab.com` or open an issue over the [project on Gitlab](https://gitlab.com/rpadovani/daintree/-/issues).

### Added

* Basic support for Networking
* Basic support for EC2
* Basic support for SQS
* Basic support SNS
description_html:
This is the first public release of Daintree. It is still an early alpha, a proof of concept to start building an open-source alternative to the AWS Console. If you find any bug, or have any feedback, please write to incoming+rpadovani-daintree-18158864-issue-@incoming.gitlab.com or open an issue over the project on Gitlab.

Added

  • Basic support for Networking
  • Basic support for EC2
  • Basic support for SQS
  • Basic support SNS
